text: These dreary years of ineffective fighting provide obvious morals for those who are judges long after the event. It seems obvious that, though the longbows of yeomen could pierce the plate and mail of French knights, a brilliant battle was no substi- tute for a sound policy, and that, if archers had no target, campaigns became mere marring route marches.
